ARABIC: يُدْخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِى رَحْمَتِهِۦ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۢا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He admits whoever He wills into His mercy. But He has prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: He admits whosoever He will to His benevolence. But for the evil-doers He has prepared a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He admits to His Mercy whomsoever He pleases. As for the wrong-doers, He has prepared for them a grievous chastisement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He admits to His mercy whomever He wants. For the unjust He has prepared a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He admits into His mercy, whomever He wills; and for the unjust He has kept prepared a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He will admit to His mercy whom He wills and as for the wrongdoers -- He has prepared a painful torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He makes whom He pleases to enter into His mercy; and (as for) the unjust, He has prepared for them a painful chastisement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: For He admits into His mercy whomsoever He will; as for the evildoers, He has prepared for them a painful chastisement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He maketh whom He will to enter His mercy, and for evil-doers hath prepared a painful doom.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He admits whoever He will into His grace and has prepared a painful punishment for the evil doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He maketh whomsoever He listeth to enter His mercy. And the wrong-doers! for them He hath gotten ready a torment afflective.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He admits whomever He wishes into His mercy, and He has prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: He will admit to His Mercy whom He will; But the wrong-doers,- for them has He prepared a grievous Penalty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He will admit to His Mercy whom He will and as for the Zalimun, (polytheists, wrong-doers, etc.) He has prepared a painful torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He is Merciful to whom He will; but, for the harmdoers He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He admits into His mercy whomever He wills. But as for the wrongdoers, He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He admits whom He wills into His mercy; but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [76:31] He admits whomever He will into His mercy, His Paradise, namely, the believers; and as for the evildoers (alzālimīna is in the accusative because of an implied verb, that is to say, a‘adda, ‘He has prepared’, as explained by [what follows]), He has prepared for them a painful chastisement — these are the disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He maketh whom He will to enter His mercy) He honours whoever deserves it with the religion of Islam, (and for evil-doers) the disbelieving idolaters (hath prepared) soon in the Hereafter (a painful doom) whose pain extends to their hearts'. And of the surah in which the Emissaries are mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 50 verses, 181 words and 816 letters: Surah 77: The Emissaries (al-Mursalat) 717 And of the surah in which the Emissaries are mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 50 verses, 181 words and 816 letters:
